author: gastown/crew/jack
text:
## Refinements from discussion

### gt commit wrapper (not hooks)

A `gt commit` wrapper command is cleaner than git hooks:
- Single implementation point
- No per-repo hook installation
- Easy to evolve (validation, conventions)
- Agents already live in gt namespace
- All roles that commit use it

### Configurable email domain

Town-level config for custom domains:

```yaml
# ~/.town/config.yaml
agent_email_domain: acme.com  # default: gastown.local
```

Pattern: `{name}@{role}.{rig}.{domain}`

Examples:
- Default: `jack@crew.gastown.gastown.local`
- Custom:  `jack@crew.gastown.acme.com`

Benefits:
- Companies get branded attribution
- Avoids .local TLD quirks
- Aligns with federation (hop://acme.com matches *@acme.com)

## Current Implementation (2026-01-19)

What exists:
- gt tap guard pr-workflow - blocks PRs and feature branches
- Hook configs in 4 settings files: beads/{crew,polecats}, gastown/{crew,polecats}
- Missing from: rig roots, witness, refinery, deacon (7 files)

The guard works by:
1. Detecting Gas Town context (env vars or /crew/, /polecats/ in path)
2. Exiting 2 to BLOCK when in agent context
3. Allowing operation for humans outside Gas Town

author: gastown/crew/max
text:
Phase 1 complete: Config-based role system implemented.

**New files:**
- `internal/config/roles.go` - RoleDefinition types, LoadRoleDefinition() with layered override resolution (builtin → town → rig)
- `internal/config/roles/*.toml` - 7 embedded role definitions (mayor, deacon, dog, witness, refinery, polecat, crew)
- `internal/config/roles_test.go` - Unit tests for loading, expansion, duration parsing

**New command:**
- `gt role def <role>` - Displays effective role configuration

**Design decisions:**
- Used TOML (not YAML) to match existing config patterns
- Added ToLegacyRoleConfig() for backward compat with existing daemon code
- Duration type with UnmarshalText for clean TOML parsing

Ready for Phase 2: Switch daemon to use LoadRoleDefinition() instead of role beads.

author: gastown/crew/max
text:
Phase 2 complete: Daemon now uses config-based roles.

**Changes:**
- `getRoleConfigForIdentity()` now uses `config.LoadRoleDefinition()` instead of reading role beads
- Layered override resolution: builtin → town → rig
- Backward compatible: returns `beads.RoleConfig` format for existing daemon code
- Updated integration tests to test config-based behavior instead of role bead behavior

All daemon and config tests pass. Ready for Phase 3: Clean up role beads.

author: gastown/crew/max
text:
Phase 3 complete: Role beads cleanup.

**Changes:**
- Removed role bead creation from `gt install` - roles are now config-based
- Removed `gt migrate-agents` command (no longer needed)
- Updated `gt doctor` role check to validate config files instead of role beads
- Removed `RoleBead` field from `AgentFields` struct
- Marked `beads_role.go` as deprecated

All builds pass. Phase 4 (documentation) is optional.
